intro: Calystegia collina subsp. venusta, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are typically light green in color. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often opening in the morning. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in disturbed areas and along roadsides. The species is part of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing growth habit and ornamental value.
